name: Conway knot
summary: A Conway knot is an 11-crossing mathematical knot that famously challenged mathematicians for decades because it was not "slice," meaning it could not be the boundary of a disk in four-dimensional space, despite fooling many mathematical "invariants" designed to test for this property. The knot, named after its discoverer John Horton Conway, was finally proven to be non-slice in 2020 by mathematician Lisa Piccirillo.
